docs.abstract: The deal fits what appears to be an accelerating trend, as oil and gas companies invest in a wide range of activities, particularly in cleaner energy.
docs.snippet: The deal fits what appears to be an accelerating trend, as oil and gas companies invest in a wide range of activities, particularly in cleaner energy.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — One major energy company has invested in a solar power developer. Another is lifting its investments in wind energy. One has even placed a small bet on nuclear fusion.

headline.main: Total, With Energy Industry in Flux, Makes $1.7 Billion Bet on a Utility
headline.print_headline: French Oil and Gas Giant Looks to Cleaner Future

docs.abstract: A federal case in Manhattan involving what the authorities say was a long-running fraud sheds light on the untamed nature of the litigation-finance business.
docs.snippet: A federal case in Manhattan involving what the authorities say was a long-running fraud sheds light on the untamed nature of the litigation-finance business.
docs.lead_paragraph: It sounded like an old school slip-and-fall scam with a modern-day financial twist.

headline.main: How a Web of Slip-and-Fall Cases Puts a New Spin on an Old-Fashioned Scheme
headline.print_headline: A New Spin  On Funding Slip-and-Fall Lawsuits

byline.original: By Matthew Goldstein and Jessica Silver-Greenberg

docs.abstract: An alliance of law firms, marketers, finance companies and doctors makes money by coaxing women to have their mesh implants removed.
docs.snippet: An alliance of law firms, marketers, finance companies and doctors makes money by coaxing women to have their mesh implants removed.
docs.lead_paragraph: Jerri Plummer was at home in Arkansas, watching television with her three children, when a stranger called to warn that her life was in danger.

headline.main: How Profiteers Lure Women Into Often-Unneeded Surgery
headline.print_headline: How Profiteers  Coax Women  Into Surgery

byline.original: By Matthew Goldstein and Jessica Silver-Greenberg

docs.abstract: The executive, Omeed Malik, was accused of inappropriate sexual conduct with a young woman, according to people briefed on the bank’s investigation.
docs.snippet: The executive, Omeed Malik, was accused of inappropriate sexual conduct with a young woman, according to people briefed on the bank’s investigation.
docs.lead_paragraph: A senior executive at Bank of America in New York departed last week after an internal investigation into a young female banker’s accusation of inappropriate sexual conduct, according to people at the bank who were briefed on the investigation.

headline.main: Bank of America Executive Departs After Misconduct Claim
headline.print_headline: Executive  Out at Bank  After Inquiry  On Conduct

byline.original: By Jessica Silver-Greenberg and Matthew Goldstein

docs.abstract: The federal authorities are looking into the relationship between trial lawyers and companies that provide high-interest advances on settlements or jury awards.
docs.snippet: The federal authorities are looking into the relationship between trial lawyers and companies that provide high-interest advances on settlements or jury awards.
docs.lead_paragraph: Federal prosecutors are investigating the fast-growing business of finance companies that provide cash advances to plaintiffs in personal injury and other lawsuits, according to five lawyers briefed on the investigation.

headline.main: Prosecutors Investigate Firms That Offer Plaintiffs Early Cash
headline.print_headline: Suing and Can’t Wait for Payout? Cash Advances With a Catch Draw Scrutiny

byline.original: By Matthew Goldstein and Jessica Silver-Greenberg

docs.abstract: The fines against the bank settle investigations into its lending practices. They are the biggest bank penalties imposed under the Trump administration.
docs.snippet: The fines against the bank settle investigations into its lending practices. They are the biggest bank penalties imposed under the Trump administration.
docs.lead_paragraph: Wells Fargo will pay two federal regulators a total of $1 billion to settle an array of investigations into its mortgage and auto-lending practices.

headline.main: Wells Fargo Pays $1 Billion to Federal Regulators
headline.print_headline: With Deal, Wells Fargo Will Pay Big Penalty

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Office of the Comptroller of the Currency

docs.abstract: Ms. Reid, who apologized in December for old anti-gay posts, said newly surfaced writings were “manipulated” by “an unknown, external party.”
docs.snippet: Ms. Reid, who apologized in December for old anti-gay posts, said newly surfaced writings were “manipulated” by “an unknown, external party.”
docs.lead_paragraph: Back in December, after a series of homophobic posts on her defunct, decade-old blog resurfaced on social media, the MSNBC host Joy Reid apologized for them. But this week, when Ms. Reid was confronted with a new batch of homophobic writings from that same period, she said she had been the victim of hackers.

headline.main: MSNBC Host Joy Reid Blames Hackers for Anti-Gay Blog Posts, but Questions Mount

docs.abstract: The retailer said it would no longer sell the shirt shown in the image, which appeared to refer to a black child as the “coolest monkey in the jungle.”
docs.snippet: The retailer said it would no longer sell the shirt shown in the image, which appeared to refer to a black child as the “coolest monkey in the jungle.”
docs.lead_paragraph: The clothing retailer H&M apologized on Monday for an image appearing in its online store that showed a black child model wearing a hooded sweatshirt that said “coolest monkey in the jungle.” The company removed the image on Monday and said it would also pull the shirt from its stores worldwide.

headline.main: H&M Apologizes for ‘Monkey’ Image Featuring Black Child
headline.print_headline: Monkey Shirt On H&M Site Raises Outcry On Internet

docs.abstract: Want guns out of your stock portfolio? Sick of bad actors like Wells Fargo and Equifax? You’ll face at least seven challenges when making an investing plan.
docs.snippet: Want guns out of your stock portfolio? Sick of bad actors like Wells Fargo and Equifax? You’ll face at least seven challenges when making an investing plan.
docs.lead_paragraph: Peer under the hood of your mutual fund or portfolio of index investments. If you’re like most people, you’ll find that you own shares of at least a few companies that make you squeamish. Perhaps you no longer wish to make money when Equifax collects and sells your data, especially when it has proved that it can’t do so safely. Or perhaps you have soured on big banks that treat customers poorly.

headline.main: Why It’s So Hard to Invest With a Social Conscience
headline.print_headline: Why It’s So Hard to Invest With a Social Conscience

docs.abstract: Each year, we ask students to send in college application essays that have something to do with money. Nearly 300 responded this year. Here are five that stood out.
docs.snippet: Each year, we ask students to send in college application essays that have something to do with money. Nearly 300 responded this year. Here are five that stood out.
docs.lead_paragraph: Each year, we post a casting call for writers and their college application essays that have something to do with money. Nearly 300 people responded this year. Below, you’ll find five that stood out for their sensitivity, depth of insight and sheer geekiness. Who would have imagined, for instance, that there was a high school student out there helping people with their tax returns — or that she could learn so much about the world by doing so?

headline.main: 5 High Schoolers and Their College Application Essays About Work, Money and Social Class
headline.print_headline: 5 Standout College Essays That Go Deep to Connect
